title: Requires the annual reporting of criminal activity on subways
summary: Requires the annual reporting of criminal activity on subways.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1389

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 7, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen. PERKINS -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Cities

       AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in
         relation to the reporting of criminal activity on subways

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 14-150 of the administrative code of  the  city  of
    2  New York is amended by adding a new subdivision d to read as follows:
    3    D.  THE NEW YORK CITY POLICE DEPARTMENT SHALL SUBMIT TO THE CITY COUN-
    4  CIL ANNUALLY A REPORT DETAILING THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CRIMINAL  COMPLAINTS
    5  AND  ARRESTS, CATEGORIZED BY CLASS OF CRIME, FOR VIOLENT FELONY OFFENSES
    6  AS DEFINED IN SECTION 70.02  OF  THE  PENAL  LAW,  ASSAULT  AND  RELATED
    7  OFFENSES  AS DEFINED IN ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED TWENTY OF THE PENAL LAW, SEX
    8  OFFENSES AS DEFINED IN ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED  THIRTY  OF  THE  PENAL  LAW,
    9  DISORDERLY  CONDUCT  AS  DEFINED  IN  SECTION  240.20  OF THE PENAL LAW,
   10  HARASSMENT AS DEFINED IN SECTION 240.25 AND 240.26  OF  THE  PENAL  LAW,
   11  AGGRAVATED  HARASSMENT  AS  DEFINED  IN SECTION 240.30 AND 240.31 OF THE
   12  PENAL LAW, AND OFFENSES AGAINST PUBLIC SENSIBILITIES AS DEFINED IN ARTI-
   13  CLE TWO HUNDRED FORTY-FIVE OF THE PENAL LAW, WHERE THE CONDUCT OCCURS ON
   14  SUBWAY LINES AND BUS ROUTES  OPERATED  BY  THE  NEW  YORK  CITY  TRANSIT
   15  AUTHORITY, SPECIFYING WHERE SUCH CRIMINAL CONDUCT HAS OCCURRED BY POLICE
   16  PRECINCT,  INCLUDING  SPECIFIC SUBWAY LINE, SUBWAY TRANSIT DIVISION, AND
   17  BUS ROUTE OPERATED BY THE NEW YORK CITY TRANSIT AUTHORITY.  SUCH  REPORT
   18  SHALL  CONTAIN  A  SEPARATE  TABULATION  FOR EMPLOYEES OF THE AUTHORITY,
   19  PASSENGERS AND OTHER NON-EMPLOYEES.  SUCH STATISTICS SHALL BE  TABULATED
   20  ON  A  MONTHLY  BASIS AND ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND SHALL BE MAINTAINED AND
   21  TRANSMITTED IN AN ELECTRONIC FORMAT TO THE  DEPARTMENT  OF  RECORDS  AND
   22  INFORMATION  SERVICES, OR ITS SUCCESSOR AGENCY, AND BE MADE AVAILABLE TO
   23  THE PUBLIC ON OR THROUGH  THE  DEPARTMENT  OF  RECORDS  AND  INFORMATION
   24  SERVICES'  WEBSITE, OR ITS SUCCESSOR'S WEBSITE. SUCH STATISTICS SHALL BE
   25  FIRST MADE AVAILABLE ON SUCH WEBSITE NINETY  DAYS  AFTER  THE  EFFECTIVE
   26  DATE  OF  THIS  SUBDIVISION  AND  SHALL BE UPDATED ON AT LEAST A MONTHLY
   27  BASIS THEREAFTER.
   28    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05441-01-1
